trans-unit.source: App model v2.0 preview: Secure an MVC web API
trans-unit.target: App model v2.0 preview: Secure an MVC web API

trans-unit.source: With the v2.0 app model, you can protecet a Web API using [OAuth 2.0](active-directory-v2-protocols.md#oauth2-authorization-code-flow) access tokens, enabling users with both personal Microsoft account and work or school accounts to securely access your Web API.
trans-unit.target: With the v2.0 app model, you can protecet a Web API using [OAuth 2.0](active-directory-v2-protocols.md#oauth2-authorization-code-flow) access tokens, enabling users with both personal Microsoft account and work or school accounts to securely access your Web API.

trans-unit.source: This visual studio solution also contains a "TodoListClient", which is a simple WPF app.
trans-unit.target: This visual studio solution also contains a "TodoListClient", which is a simple WPF app.

trans-unit.source: The TodoListClient is used to demonstrate how a user signs-in and how a client can issue requests to your Web API.
trans-unit.target: The TodoListClient is used to demonstrate how a user signs-in and how a client can issue requests to your Web API.

trans-unit.source: In this case, both the TodoListClient and the TodoListService are represented by the same app.
trans-unit.target: In this case, both the TodoListClient and the TodoListService are represented by the same app.

trans-unit.source: Copy down the **Redirect URI** from the portal.

trans-unit.source: To begin, open the solution and add the OWIN middleware NuGet packages to the TodoListService project using the Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: To begin, open the solution and add the OWIN middleware NuGet packages to the TodoListService project using the Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Add an OWIN Startup class to the TodoListService project called `Startup.cs`.
trans-unit.target: Add an OWIN Startup class to the TodoListService project called `Startup.cs`.

trans-unit.source: Right click on the project --> **Add** --> **New Item** --> Search for “OWIN”.
trans-unit.target: Right click on the project --> **Add** --> **New Item** --> Search for “OWIN”.

trans-unit.source: The OWIN middleware will invoke the `Configuration(…)` method when your app starts.
trans-unit.target: The OWIN middleware will invoke the `Configuration(…)` method when your app starts.

trans-unit.source: Change the class declaration to `public partial class Startup` - we’ve already implemented part of this class for you in another file.
trans-unit.target: Change the class declaration to `public partial class Startup` - we’ve already implemented part of this class for you in another file.

trans-unit.source: In the `Configuration(…)` method, make a call to ConfgureAuth(…) to set up authentication for your web app.
trans-unit.target: In the `Configuration(…)` method, make a call to ConfgureAuth(…) to set up authentication for your web app.

trans-unit.source: Open the file `App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs` and implement the `ConfigureAuth(…)` method, which will set up the Web API to accept tokens from the v2.0 endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Open the file `App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs` and implement the `ConfigureAuth(…)` method, which will set up the Web API to accept tokens from the v2.0 endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Now you can use `[Authorize]` attributes to protect your controllers and actions with OAuth 2.0 bearer authentication.
trans-unit.target: Now you can use `[Authorize]` attributes to protect your controllers and actions with OAuth 2.0 bearer authentication.

trans-unit.source: Decorate the `Controllers\TodoListController.cs` class with an authorize tag.
trans-unit.target: Decorate the `Controllers\TodoListController.cs` class with an authorize tag.
